sentences.sContent: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.sCn: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.sContent: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.sCn: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

sentences.sContent: ...The question will confront New Yorkers in February as the city's first robotic parking opens in Chinatown...
...Happiness will be achieved only when we show great courage to confront problems and develop the capacity to solve them...

remMethod.val: con ＋ front(前面) → 在前面出现 → 迎面遇到

trans.tranOther: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb
